Union Minister Nitin Gadkari (second from left) and J&K Deputy Chief Minister Nirmal Singh (left) with PDP chief Mehooba Mufti at her residence in Srinagar on Sunday.— PHOTO:NISSAR AHMAD

“This is not the time to discuss politics. We have come to express our condolences…The dream of the Mufti sahib for Jammu and Kashmir will be fulfilled,” he said.

Leader of the Opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad and Ambika Soni, the AICC general secretary in charge of the Congress in the State, accompanied Ms. Gandhi to the PDP president’s residence in the afternoon.“Ms. Gandhi came to express condolences because the Mufti had a long association with the Gandhi family,” said Mr. Azad.In the evening, Ms. Mufti broke down as she made a small speech to her party leaders on the Mufti’s legacy.

“Mufti sahib had a dream to bring India and Pakistan closer, and the party intends to pursue it. It’s not possible to work on this front with the Congress but only with the BJP at this time,” said a senior PDP leader on the Sonia-Mehbooba meeting.

The Mufti’s political adviser, Waheed Parra, said: “The PDP-BJP alliance will be pursued but the swearing-in of Ms. Mehbooba may take a little time.”
title: J&K govt. formation gathers pace
